description: a flatbread that's typically topped with cheese, tomato, and other ingredients, and then baked
sandwich with a ground beef patty, cheese, and various toppings
a thin, crispy  flatbread that's typically topped with cheese, tomato, and other ingredients, and then baked
a mexican dish of a flour tortilla wrapped around a filling. typical fillings include meat, beans, rice, cheese, salsa, and vegetables.
a cut of beef that's made from muscle tissue. it can be seasoned with salt and pepper, or with herbs and spices. steaks can be cooked on the stove, grill, or in the oven
a dish made with cooked macaroni pasta covered in a creamy cheese sauce, typically using cheddar cheese, and usually baked with a breadcrumb topping
an indian dish of spiced chicken in a creamy tomato sauce served over rice. the dish often includes garam masala, cumin, coriander, and other spices
a dish of crispy fried chicken in a sweet and sticky sauce. the dish is often served with steamed rice and vegetables
a hearty stew-like dish made with meat, chili peppers, tomatoes, and other ingredients. it can be spicy, medium, or mild.
a baked pasta dish made of layers of flat pasta sheets, sauce, and other ingredients
a pasta dish made with fatty cured pork, hard cheese, eggs, salt, and black pepper
a pasta dish of fettuccine tossed in butter and parmesan cheese. the butter and cheese melt and emulsify to create a rich, creamy sauce
an italian baked turnover made from pizza dough folded over a filling
a type of pasta made from potato dumplings that are typically flavored with herbs and seasonings. the dumplings are often served in sauce, but can also be fried.
an italian dish of thin-sliced meat wrapped around prosciutto and sage, then cooked in butter or wine. the name literally means "it jumps in the mouth

a classic french dish featuring chicken pieces braised in a rich red wine sauce, typically alongside bacon, mushrooms, onions, carrots, and herbs like thyme and bay leaves, translating literally to "rooster in wine" in french; it's considered a hearty stew with tender chicken and a deeply flavorful sauce, often served with crusty bread or mashed potatoes

a traditional french fish stew known for its rich, flavorful broth made with a variety of fresh mediterranean fish, shellfish, vegetables like onions, tomatoes, fennel, and key spices like saffron, garlic, and orange zest, all simmered quickly in olive oil; the cooked fish is usually served separately from the broth, which is often enjoyed with toasted bread to soak up the flavors
a french dish of duck that's been cured and slow-cooked in duck fat. the result is tender, silky meat that's rich and savory
a hearty, slow-cooked french stew made with beans, meat, and herbs. the dish originated in the languedoc region of france and is often made with duck confit, sausage, and white beans

a classic french savory tart made with a pastry crust filled with a creamy custard mixture of eggs, cream, and bacon, originating from the lorraine region of france; it is typically served with grated cheese like gruyère, and can be enjoyed warm or cold
a french dish of floured and pan-fried sole served with lemon, parsley, and melted butter. the name translates to "miller's wife" and refers to the flour used to coat the fish.
a gooey, creamy baked casserole of potatoes, cream, cheese, bacon, and onions

a small, typically soft corn tortilla filled with seasoned meat (like marinated beef, pork, or chicken), usually topped with only a few simple ingredients like chopped onions, cilantro, and a squeeze of lime, often served with a side of salsa; the key is the minimal toppings and focus on the fresh, flavorful meat and small tortilla size, making them perfect for grabbing on the go
a rich, complex, dark red-brown sauce commonly served over turkey or chicken
a mexican dish of rolled tortillas filled with various ingredients and covered in sauce. they are often baked.
a traditional mexican soup made with hominy, meat, and broth, seasoned with chiles and spices. it's often served with accompaniments like cabbage, radishes, and avocado
a traditional mexican dish of corn dough wrapped around fillings and steamed
a traditional mexican dish of slow-roasted pork. the name means "little pig cooked underground".
a flavorful mexican stew or soup made with meat marinated in chilies, spices, and herbs, and then braised in broth. it's often served with tortillas, onions, cilantro, and lime.
a mexican dish of grilled beef that's marinated and thinly sliced. the term translates to "grilled meat" in spanish
a japanese dish of vinegared rice and other ingredients, such as seafood, vegetables, or eggs. the word "sushi" translates to "sour rice" in japanese.
a japanese noodle soup made with wheat noodles, broth, and various toppings. the broth is often flavored with soy sauce or miso.
a japanese dish of lightly battered shrimp that's deep-fried until crispy. it's often served with a dipping sauce.
a japanese dish of deep-fried pork cutlets. the name comes from the japanese words ton (pork) and katsu (cutlet). tonkatsu is similar to the german dish schnitzel.
a japanese dish of bite-sized pieces of chicken that are skewered and grilled. the word "yakitori" literally translates to "grilled chicken".
a thick, chewy, japanese noodle made from wheat flour. it can be served in soups, stir-fried, or boiled, and is often accompanied by vegetables and tempura.
a savory japanese pancake made from flour, cabbage, egg, and other ingredients, cooked on a griddle and topped with sauce and garnishes. the name translates to "what you want grilled".
a japanese hot pot dish of thinly sliced meat and vegetables cooked in broth. the name comes from the sound "swish swish" that the meat makes when stirred in the pot.

a japanese dish of rice served in a bowl with meat, vegetables, or seafood on top. the word donburi literally means "bowl".  donburi is made by simmering ingredients together and serving them over rice.
a popular middle eastern dish of marinated meat that's cooked on a vertical rotisserie and served in a wrap or sandwich. the word "shawarma" is arabic for "turning".
a meatball or meatloaf-like dish typically made from ground meat (like beef, lamb, or chicken), mixed with spices, onions, garlic, and sometimes other herbs,

a levantine salad of finely chopped parsley, soaked bulgur, tomatoes, mint, and onion, seasoned with olive oil, lemon juice, salt and sweet pepper. some variations add lettuce, or use semolina instead of bulgur.
a dish of eggs poached in a spicy tomato sauce with vegetables
deep-fried balls or patties made from chickpeas or fava beans, sometimes both, plus fresh herbs and spices.
a traditional jordanian dish made with lamb, rice, jameed, and other ingredients.

a middle eastern dish of seasoned ground meat and bulgur wheat that's formed into balls or patties. it can be baked, fried, grilled, or eaten raw. kibbeh is similar to falafel, but richer because it contains meat.
a baked dish of eggplant, ground meat, and a creamy sauce. it's a classic mediterranean dish that's most commonly associated with greece and turkey.
a greek dish of meat or vegetables on a skewer that's grilled and often eaten in a pita. the word souvlaki roughly translates to "skewer".
a mediterranean dish of seasoned vegetables, meat, or seafood stuffed into leaves or hollowed-out fruits. the word "dolma" comes from the turkish word dolmak, which means "stuffed".
a greek savory pie made with spinach, feta cheese, and flaky phyllo dough
a greek dish of meat cooked on a vertical rotisserie, then sliced and served in a pita with vegetables and tzatziki sauce.
a greek beef stew that's seasoned with red wine, warming spices, and lots of onions.
a greek bean soup made with white beans, vegetables, olive oil, and herbs. it's a hearty, nourishing soup that's often eaten in the winter.
a traditional greek dish of slow-cooked lamb. the greek word kleftiko translates to "stolen meat".
a famous chinese dish of roasted duck with crispy skin and tender meat. it's often served with pancakes, scallions, and hoisin sauce.

a spicy, stir-fried chinese dish originating from sichuan cuisine, featuring cubed chicken, peanuts, vegetables, dried chili peppers, and often sichuan peppercorns, all tossed in a savory sauce with a balance of sweet and spicy flavors; it's known for its bold taste and is typically quite hot due to the chili peppers and sichuan peppercorns.
a spicy chinese dish of tofu in a chili-bean sauce with minced meat and sichuan peppercorns. the name roughly translates to "pockmarked grandma's tofu".
a traditional cantonese dish made with bite-sized pieces of pork in a sweet and tangy sauce. the dish often includes vegetables like onions, bell peppers, and carrots.

a communal dining experience where diners cook a variety of raw ingredients like thinly sliced meat, seafood, vegetables, tofu, and noodles by dipping them into a simmering pot of flavored broth placed on a tabletop burner, allowing for quick cooking right at the table
a chinese dish of stir-fried noodles, vegetables, and sometimes meat. the word "chow mein" comes from the taishan dialect of chinese, where "chau" means stir-fried and "meing" means noodles.
a traditional chinese sticky rice dumpling wrapped in bamboo or reed leaves and filled with sweet or savory ingredients. the dumplings are often pyramid-shaped and can be boiled or steamed.

a popular chinese dish consisting of stir-fried sliced beef and broccoli florets, typically cooked in a savory sauce made with soy sauce, oyster sauce, garlic, ginger, and sometimes a touch of sugar, creating a rich and flavorful combination; it's often served over rice and is considered a staple at many chinese restaurants in the west.
a cantonese-style barbecue pork that's sweet, salty, and smoky. it's made by marinating pork in a sauce and then roasting it.
a rich and flavorful indian dish of chicken in a creamy, spiced tomato sauce.
a flavorful, layered rice dish that typically includes meat or seafood, spices, herbs, and fried onions. the word biryani comes from the farsi phrase birinj biriyan, which means "fried rice".
a flavorful, medium-heat curry made by braising lamb or mutton in a spiced gravy. the dish is known for its thick, red sauce.

a popular indian vegetarian dish where chunks of paneer (indian cottage cheese) are marinated in a blend of spices and yogurt, then skewered with vegetables like bell peppers, onions, and tomatoes, and grilled in a tandoor until slightly charred, typically served with lemon juice and chaat masala
a popular north indian vegetarian dish consisting of chickpeas simmered in a spiced onion-tomato gravy, where "chana" means chickpeas and "masala" refers to a blend of spices

a dish where chicken is marinated in a blend of yogurt, spices like garam masala, cumin, turmeric, ginger, garlic, and chili powder, then cooked in a tandoor (a cylindrical clay oven), resulting in a smoky, tender, and flavorful grilled chicken with a vibrant red color
a spicy, flavorful, and aromatic indian curry dish. it's typically made with vinegar, chilies, and a variety of spices.
a thai dish of stir-fried rice noodles, eggs, and other ingredients. it's sweet, sour, salty, and umami, and is often served with peanuts and lime wedges.

a fragrant thai dish featuring a creamy coconut milk-based sauce flavored with a vibrant green curry paste, typically made with green chilies, shallots, garlic, lemongrass, shrimp paste, kaffir lime leaves, and sometimes cumin seeds
a rich, mildly spiced thai curry that combines ingredients from multiple cultures. it's made with a red curry paste, coconut milk, peanuts, and a variety of spices
a coconut-based thai curry soup with egg noodles, meat, and spices

minced meat (often pork, chicken, or beef) mixed with a vibrant dressing of lime juice, fish sauce, toasted rice powder, fresh herbs like mint and cilantro, and chili peppers for spice, creating a flavorful "meat salad" typically served with sticky rice
a classic thai coconut chicken soup featuring a rich broth made with coconut milk, lemongrass, galangal, kaffir lime leaves, and seasoned with fish sauce, lime juice, and often a touch of sugar
a spanish dish of rice, vegetables, meat or seafood, and saffron. the ingredients vary depending on the type of paella and the region where it's made
a spanish dish of eggs, potatoes, and onions. it's a classic tapas dish that's often served at room temperature.
a hearty spanish bean stew made with white beans, pork, sausage, and paprika. the beans are soaked overnight and the stew is often served with slices of chorizo and blood sausage on top.

a traditional spanish dish featuring a roasted suckling pig, known for its incredibly tender meat and crispy skin, typically made with a very young piglet that is only fed on its mother's milk, resulting in a rich, delicate flavor

a traditional spanish dish featuring salted cod (bacalao) cooked in a rich, flavorful sauce made primarily with roasted red peppers, onions, garlic, olive oil, and sometimes tomatoes, creating a vibrant red color and a savory, slightly spicy flavor

a korean dish of warm rice, vegetables, meat or seafood, and egg, all topped with gochujang (a spicy red pepper paste). the name comes from the korean words bibim which means "mixing" and bap which means "rice

a classic korean dish featuring a spicy, rich stew made primarily with kimchi, pork belly (or other meat), tofu, scallions, garlic, and often seasoned with gochugaru (korean red pepper flakes) and gochujang (korean chili paste)
a korean dish of thinly sliced beef that's marinated and then grilled or stir-fried. the beef is usually ribeye, sirloin, tenderloin, or brisket

a popular korean dish featuring thinly sliced pork belly, often grilled on a tabletop grill, and literally translates to "three-layer meat" in korean, referring to the visible layers of fat and lean meat within the cut
a korean stew made with soft tofu, gochugaru (korean red pepper flakes), and other ingredients in broth. the name translates to "soft tofu stew
a korean dish of grilled beef short ribs that's often marinated in a sweet and savory sauce. the word "galbi" means "rib" in korean

a korean dish of chewy, cold noodles in broth. the noodles are commonly made from buckwheat flour and starch, but can also include sweet potato, potato, arrowroot, or kudzu. the broth is often made with beef stock and dongchimi, a brine from fermented radish kimchi

a popular korean dish consisting of spicy stir-fried chicken, typically marinated in a gochujang-based sauce, along with vegetables like cabbage, sweet potato, and often rice cakes (tteok), all cooked together in a pan
a savory dish of minced meat topped with mashed potatoes and baked. it's often made with ground lamb, but beef can also be used. the dish is also known as cottage pie or hachis parmentier.

a classic british dish consisting of battered and deep-fried fish, usually cod or haddock, served alongside thick-cut fried potatoes (chips), often accompanied by a squeeze of lemon and a side of tartar sauce
a hawaiian dish of raw fish that's marinated and served with rice, vegetables, and other ingredients. the word "poke" means "chunk" or "something cut away" in the polynesian language.

a hawaiian dish featuring grilled chicken that's marinated and basted in a sweet and savory sauce, often made with a blend of soy sauce, brown sugar, pineapple juice, ketchup, ginger, and sometimes garlic
a tex-mex dish of grilled meat, onions, and peppers served in tortillas with toppings. the meat is usually beef or chicken, but you can also use shrimp.

a mexican dish made by filling a tortilla with cheese, sometimes accompanied by other ingredients like meat, vegetables, or beans, then folding it in half and cooking until the cheese melts and the tortilla crisps up
a cut of meat from the ribcage of a pig or cow that's been seasoned, cooked, and served with barbecue sauce.
chicken wings coated in a cayenne pepper hot sauce and butter, and then deep-fried. they are often served with celery and blue cheese dressing.
a hearty american dish of beef that's braised with vegetables in liquid until tender. common ingredients include chuck roast, onions, carrots, potatoes, and seasonings

a savory dish that typically includes meat, seafood, vegetables, stock, rice, and seasonings. it's often associated with louisiana and is made with a base of onions, bell peppers, and celery called the "holy trinity
a flavorful fish that comes in a variety of species, including sockeye, king, coho, keta, and pink

a dish where pieces of chicken are coated with seasoned flour or batter and then cooked by frying, typically resulting in a crispy exterior and juicy interior, often served with the bones still in the meat
a savory dish made with chicken, vegetables, and a pastry crust
bite-sized pieces of chicken that are coated with breading or batter and then fried or baked. they are a popular fast food item a

a sandwich made with a long french bread roll, meat, and various toppings. the meat is typically fried seafood, roast beef, or ham. po' boys are often dressed with lettuce, tomato, pickles, and hot sauce
a classic american dish of chopped lettuce, chicken, bacon, hard-boiled eggs, tomatoes, and other ingredients. the ingredients are arranged in rows on a platter.

a classic green salad made with romaine lettuce, croutons, grated parmesan cheese, and a distinctive caesar dressing that typically includes ingredients like lemon juice, olive oil, dijon mustard, garlic, worcestershire sauce, and anchovies, creating a rich and savory flavor profile

salad typically includes romaine lettuce, tomatoes, olives, pepperoncinis, and parmesan cheese. other common ingredients include red onion, radicchio, and croutons. italian dressing is made with olive oil, red wine vinegar, salt, and pepper.
a salad that typically includes lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, beans, and taco meat, and is often served in a tortilla shell
a salad made with vegetables, olives, feta cheese, and seasoned with oregano. a traditional greek salad recipe is called horiatiki salata
a middle eastern salad made with vegetables, herbs, and toasted or fried pita bread. the salad is often dressed with a tangy vinaigrette made with lemon juice, olive oil, and sumac
a salad made with iceberg lettuce wedges and a variety of toppings, including bacon, tomatoes, onions, and blue cheese dressing

a cold dish typically made with cooked pasta, chopped vegetables like tomatoes, cucumbers, bell peppers, onions, and sometimes cheese, all tossed together with a vinaigrette dressing, often italian-style, and usually served chilled
a grilled sandwich made with corned beef, swiss cheese, sauerkraut, and dressing on rye bread
a classic american sandwich typically made with three slices of toasted bread layered with cooked poultry (like turkey or chicken), bacon, lettuce, tomato, and mayonnaise
a sandwich made with thin-sliced meat, cheese, onions, and a hoagie roll. the meat is typically cooked on a griddle

a classic american fast food staple, featuring a piece of crispy, fried chicken between two slices of bread, often accompanied by toppings like lettuce, tomato, pickles, mayonnaise, and sometimes a spicy sauce

a pulled pork sandwich is a classic american barbecue dish, featuring shredded, slow-smoked pork shoulder piled on a bun and typically topped with barbecue sauce, often accompanied by coleslaw or other sides

a classic american dish featuring a toasted sandwich made with bread and melted cheese, typically cheddar, served alongside a bowl of tomato soup; the combination of the crispy bread, gooey cheese, and warm, flavorful soup is a comforting meal
a sandwich made with bacon, lettuce, and tomato. the name comes from the initials of the three main ingredients.
a hot sandwich of thinly sliced meat on a french roll or baguette, served with au jus for dipping
a sandwich made with cured meats, cheese, and vegetables. it can also be called an italian sub, hoagie, or grinder
a sandwich made of ground beef, onions, tomatoes, and other seasonings, served on a bun. the name comes from how messy it is to eat
the sandwich primarily consists of meatballs, a tomato sauce or marinara sauce, and bread, such as italian bread, baguette and bread rolls
a comforting dish made with chicken, vegetables, noodles, and broth.
a vietnamese soup made with broth, rice noodles, meat, and various garnishes. the broth is typically made by slowly simmering beef bones
a hearty italian vegetable soup made with tomato-y broth and pasta or rice
a classic french dish made with caramelized onions, beef broth, and cheese, and topped with bread.

a rich, creamy soup primarily made with clams, diced potatoes, onions, celery, and often thickened with a roux in a broth made with clam juice, milk, or heavy cream, resulting in a hearty and flavorful dish

a creamy, rich soup made with a base of mushrooms, often pureed, thickened with a roux (butter and flour), and then blended with cream or milk, typically featuring additional flavors like onion, garlic, and herbs

a hearty soup made primarily with lentils, typically cooked with vegetables like carrots, celery, onions, and often seasoned with spices like cumin, coriander, garlic, and sometimes tomato, resulting in a filling and flavorful broth that can be served with a squeeze of lemon juice
a creamy soup made with pureed broccoli, broth, and cheddar cheese. the broccoli adds texture and a subtle sweetness that complements the cheese
a soup made with chicken broth combined with roasted tomatoes, onion, garlic, chiles and tortillas, cut into strips and fried
